channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Rudy Giuliani ordered to turn over NYC apartment, 26 watches to Georgia election workers
item.description: A federal judge has ordered Rudy Giuliani to turn over his New York City apartment and various other assets to two Georgia election workers who won a $148 million defamation judgment against him.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge has ordered Rudy Giuliani to turn over his New York City apartment and various other assets to two Georgia election workers who won a $148 million defamation judgment against him.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 1 dead, dozens sickened in E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounders
item.description: E. coli food poisoning linked to McDonald’s Quarter Pounder hamburgers has sickened at least 49 people in 10 states, including one person who died, federal health officials said.
item.content:encoded:
E. coli food poisoning linked to McDonald’s Quarter Pounder hamburgers has sickened at least 49 people in 10 states, including one person who died, federal health officials said.

(Image credit: Gene J. Puskar)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Israel says it killed a top Hezbollah official expected to be the group's next leader
item.description: The Israeli military said that one of its airstrikes earlier this month killed Hashem Safieddine. There was no immediate confirmation from the militant group about the fate of top official.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military said that one of its airstrikes earlier this month killed Hashem Safieddine. There was no immediate confirmation from the militant group about the fate of top official.

(Image credit: Bilal Hussein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Nightclub Turned Shelter in Beirut
item.description:
More than a fifth of Lebanon's population is now displaced, mostly fleeing from the country's south as Israel carries out airstrikes against the Iran-backed group Hezbollah there. With so many people out of their homes, they're taking refuge anywhere they can, including in one of Beirut's most popular nightclubs. Our reporter in Lebanon introduces us to some of the displaced.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates.
item.content:encoded:
More than a fifth of Lebanon's population is now displaced, mostly fleeing from the country's south as Israel carries out airstrikes against the Iran-backed group Hezbollah there. With so many people out of their homes, they're taking refuge anywhere they can, including in one of Beirut's most popular nightclubs. Our reporter in Lebanon introduces us to some of the displaced.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates.

(Image credit: Fadel Itani)
item.dc:creator: Arezou Rezvani

item.title: Olivia Nuzzi and 'New York Magazine' have split over her relationship with RFK Jr.
item.description: The magazine said the two parties agreed to part ways, though an investigation found no inaccuracies or bias in Nuzzi’s reporting. Meanwhile, Nuzzi and her ex-fiancé are blaming each other in court.
item.content:encoded:
The magazine said the two parties agreed to part ways, though an investigation found no inaccuracies or bias in Nuzzi’s reporting. Meanwhile, Nuzzi and her ex-fiancé are blaming each other in court.

(Image credit: Alexander Tamargo)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Why this country is seeing a 'staggering' increase in the number of rapes
item.description: New reports from Physicians for Human Rights and Doctors Without Borders document a "massive influx" of sexual violence in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. What can be done to stop it?
item.content:encoded:
New reports from Physicians for Human Rights and Doctors Without Borders document a "massive influx" of sexual violence in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. What can be done to stop it?

(Image credit: Alexis Huguet)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: 5 people are dead and a teenager is in custody after a shooting in Washington state
item.description: Two adults and three teenagers are dead after a Monday morning shooting in a home in Fall City, Wash. A 15-year-old male was taken into custody.
item.content:encoded: Two adults and three teenagers are dead after a Monday morning shooting in a home in Fall City, Wash. A 15-year-old male was taken into custody.
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: U.S. intel officials say Russia is behind attempts to smear Tim Walz
item.description: A video making lurid and false claims about the Democratic vice presidential candidate was spread by pro-Trump accounts. Intelligence officials say Russia was behind the video.
item.content:encoded:
A video making lurid and false claims about the Democratic vice presidential candidate was spread by pro-Trump accounts. Intelligence officials say Russia was behind the video.

(Image credit: Natalia Kolesnikova)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Honda recalls 700,000 Accords, Civics and CR-Vs for fuel pumps that can leak
item.description: Honda said there are no reports of injuries or deaths related to the issue. It is the second major recall this month at Honda, after 1.7 million vehicles were found to have potential steering issues.
item.content:encoded:
Honda said there are no reports of injuries or deaths related to the issue. It is the second major recall this month at Honda, after 1.7 million vehicles were found to have potential steering issues.

(Image credit: Kyodo News)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What do Elon Musk and other billionaires want in return for backing Trump?
item.description: New Yorker writer Susan Glasser says Trump is highly transactional, so billionaires may be betting on access and a seat at the table if he’s re-elected. It’s what some of them got in his first term.
item.content:encoded: New Yorker writer Susan Glasser says Trump is highly transactional, so billionaires may be betting on access and a seat at the table if he’s re-elected. It’s what some of them got in his first term.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross
